title: How Matt Damon got in shape for 'The Martian'
text:
Matt Damon is known for undergoing physical transformation for films. He ensured he looked the part in Ridley Scott's The Martian as well in which he plays astronaut Mark Watney, who gets stranded on Mars.
READ: Matt Damon clarifies comments about gay actors
Matt told us " I had to get in shape (for the role). Those astronauts are incredibly physically fit as everything is measured for them. Once you go out on a mission, you are sending back your human waste and they examine it under a microscope to see the effects of space travel."
Here's more on the astronaut training equipment, the actor used to play a character that survives Martian gravity and extreme altitude conditions.
Cycle Ergometer
It's a space shuttle exercise bike, just like a stationary bicycle, to measure fitness in space.
Harnessed Treadmill
Since lack of gravity tends to make people float, Matt used harnesses to help hold him to the walking surface.
Resistance Exercise Device (RED)
The RED looks like weight-lifting machines you may see on television. To use it,astronauts pull and twist stretchy rubber-band-like cords attached to pulleys. The RED can be used for a total body workout.
The sci-fi releases in India on October 2, alongside its US release date and will be dubbed in Hindi, Tamil and Telugu.
